title.narrative: Improving Water Governance at Local Levl

description.narrative:
Improving Water Governance at Local Level in 03 Districts of Pakistan This project is contributing to overcome the issues of tail end farmers in Sindh and Punjab. Follwing issues exist at water distribution levels:
Tail end and small farmers receive no or less water as compared to their right Delayed water supply resulting in wastage, not aligned with cropping patterns Water losses (katcha water courses, water wastage) Less agriculture production Conflicts among water users especially the tail end farmers Large landholders influence the timing and supply of water No information system exists for small and tail end farmers to inform them about the opening and closure of any canals/distributaries. Polluted irrigation system due to sewerage and industries Over installation of tube wells to extract ground water for irrigation Non transparent system of income and expenses in canal irrigation department properties including rest houses and other installments Katcha water courses are not maintained/aligned on regular basis Illegal mogas/nakkas No irrigation system exists for farmers of riverine and desert areas Water as commodity Keeping in view the above mentioned issues, below are the proposed objectives and suitable activities to contributein, Overall Objective: To contribute towards improvement of the water governance at local level by informing policy formulation process for equitable distribution, better management and enhancedproductivity. Specific Objectives 1: To mobilize and organize partner communities at local level for their water rights Specific Objectives 2: Catalyze the water policy formulation process at the provincial level and inform the process through generating a samplemicro water policy package at the levels of selected districts addressing specifically the issues of tail end farmers.
Through theintervention Indus Consortium will organize local communities especially tail end farmers of three canals of Sindh and Punjab for demand generation. Through the activities IC will conduct researches from reputable organizations and research institutions to get in-depth knowledge regarding the policy frameworks, laws and intuitions exists at various levels. After the findings of researches IC will conduct the trainings ofit#s and partners staff members and community leaders. IC will engage one consultant, one lawyer and different stakeholders working in water sector and develop a policy addressing the concerns of tail end farmers and its presentation to provincial governments of both provinces. This project wills basically contributing to the concerns of tail end farmers in the formulation of pro tail end farmers polices of water sector at provincial level.

participating-org.narrative:
The Laar Humanitarian Development Programme has as mandate: disaster risk management and sustainable livelihoods initiatives. LHDP has worked on sustainable livelihood initiatives in the district of Badine, funded by the EU in partnership with Oxfam Novib.
LHDP is part of Oxfam International Consortium on DRR. This grant will help the partner to undertake urgently needed preparatory humanitarian work. The initial preparatory work will help to engage with the district government and to contribute fromthe inception of theresponse works.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands
